name: NHL 25 – Strategy Map (Canon v5)
description: Single source of truth for NHL 25 team system options. Uses only real in-game strategy names and values.

notes: 1-2-2 Passive = safest, best for protecting leads and limiting rush chances.
1-2-2 Aggressive = more pressure, better for comebacks but riskier defensively.
2-3 = good vs teams that like to carry through middle; clogs NZ.
Weak Side Lock = best vs heavy forecheck + cycle teams; forces dump-ins and bad retrievals.
1-2-2 Red = balanced NZ pressure; good default.
1-2-2 Blue = slightly more conservative; sits a bit deeper.
1-3-1 = best for forcing dump-ins and creating counter attacks.
1-4 = heavy trap; best for protecting a lead late in the game.

trap_forecheck_slider.label: Trap Forecheck

scale_definition.0: Full neutral-zone trap, almost no forecheck pressure.
scale_definition.1: Very trap-heavy; strong NZ stack, low pressure.
scale_definition.2: Trap leaning; still conservative but will pressure bad touches.
scale_definition.4: Pressure leaning; more aggressive on puck carrier.
scale_definition.5: High forecheck pressure; accepts more odd-man rush risk.
scale_definition.6: Max forecheck pressure; use only when trailing or chasing momentum.

notes: 0–2 = best when protecting leads or vs much stronger teams.
3 = good default for most regular-season games.
4–6 = best when chasing the game or vs weak breakout teams.
Protect Net = collapses to the slot; best when defending a lead or vs high slot shooters.
Contain Puck = keeps play to the outside; strong vs cycle teams.
Normal = balanced pressure; good all-purpose choice.
Puck Side Attack = sends extra pressure at the puck; good vs point shooting and hesitant puck carriers.
High Pressure = aggressive everywhere; use carefully to avoid breakdowns.
Collapsing = protects the slot; allows more point shots.
Staggered = hybrid that guards both slot and points; best overall default.
Tight Point = pressures point shooters; better vs teams that shoot from blue line a lot.
Defend Lead = safest; forwards help low in DZ, fewer risky plays.
Conservative = slightly defensive; good when protecting a one-goal lead.
Standard = neutral; best baseline for most of the game.
Aggressive = more O-zone support and pinches; better when chasing.
Full Attack = maximum offense; use only when trailing late.
Strong Side Slant = safest all-around breakout; uses support on strong side.
Blue-to-Blue = stretches defenders; good vs traps and for long stretch passes.
3-High = very aggressive; extra forwards fly the zone for offense.
Stay Wide = forwards stretch to the boards; opens up lane passes and wide entries.
Leave Zone Early = forwards cheat for offense; good vs slow D or when chasing the game.
Close Support = safest; best vs aggressive forechecks and when protecting a lead.
Use 0–10 scale exactly as shown in-game.
5 = perfectly balanced between both ends of each slider.
This template is used by separate line-specific JSON files (e.g., Leafs_LineSliders_v5).
Hold Line/Pinch controls how aggressive D are at the blue line.
Cycle/Shoot on D controls how much they attack puck vs protect slot.
